{/* Cover Image */}

Healthy Diet During Pregnancy

Healthy Weight Gain During Pregnancy

Importance of Healthy Weight Gain

  • Supports baby’s growth and development.
  • Essential for maternal health and postpartum recovery.

Risks of Excess Weight Gain

  • Increases chances of gestational diabetes and high blood pressure.
  • Can make it harder to lose weight after pregnancy.

Recommended Weight Gain (Based on BMI at Start of Pregnancy)

  • Underweight (BMI < 18.5) → 12.5 - 18 kg
  • Normal weight (BMI 18.5 - 24.9) → 11.5 - 16 kg
  • Overweight (BMI 25 - 29.9) → 7 - 11.5 kg
  • Obese (BMI ≥ 30) → 5 - 9 kg

Healthy Eating for Weight Management

  • Eat according to appetite without overeating.
  • Focus on balanced nutrition (lean proteins, whole grains, fruits, and vegetables).
  • Limit high-calorie, low-nutrient foods.

Monitoring Weight During Pregnancy

  • Regular weight check-ups with a healthcare provider.
  • Consult a midwife, GP, dietitian, or obstetrician if unsure about weight gain.

Would you like a BMI calculator or weight tracker feature in the app?

); }; export default DietPlan;
